text: Good morning!
Good morning
How are you doing today?
Great thanks!  How are you?
I'm good, thanks!  Today I am informing people about a charity called Save the Children.  Have you heard of them?
I don't think so.
They are an international organization who help protect children's rights as well as providing relief and support in developing countries
I see.  A worthy cause indeed.
They definitely are!  They are also very transparent about where their donations go which is something I always like to see in a charity.
Yes, that's a very important attribute.
86% goes directly to program services, 9% to fundraising, and only 5% goes to management and general accounts
Seems like a valid distribution.
How often do you donate to charity?
I do not.
Let me ask you this then; how much money do you typically spend on coffee, tea, and/or soft drinks in a week?
I don't buy beverages when I'm out.  I do buy coffee to make at home and I do buy canned drinks for home/work use as well. I cannot afford to guy extraneous beverages.
Would you be willing to forgo your canned drinks you purchase at the grocery store for a week and donate to help save a child's life?
No, I would not.  As it is, I've already cut back on cable, now I use over the air antenna, and just about all other expenses that I can think of.
Wow.  You will continue drink your coffee at home while there are children starving around the world and not think twice about it?

Yes, with absolutely no guilt.  I realize that there are people suffering but as I say, right now, any way I can eliminate an expense would go to paying off my debt.  Then, I would gladly look into donating to a worthwhile charity like yours.
You could very easily donate ANY portion of the $2.00 you will potentially make doing this right now, and not lose anything.  Is THAT something you would do?
Yes, I will donate $1.00.
Awesome.  Thank you so much!  That $1.00 will go further than you think in helping children.
